priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Device Identifier Parameter Long Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106480

self.title: CDISC SDTM Device Identifier Parameter Long Name Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist for the long name of the identifier characteristic of the device.
name: Device Identifier Long Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Device Identifier Parameter Long Name Terminology

terms.definition: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product that is produced in a manner that is expected to render it homogeneous.
A unique manufacturer-assigned identifier used to distinguish a specific product from others in a catalog of products offered.
Generic category of medical device within the device classification established by a regulatory authority.

A UDI is a unique numeric or alphanumeric code that includes a device identifier, which is specific to a device model, and a production identifier, which includes the current production information for that specific device, such as the lot or batch number, the serial number and/or expiration date. (FDA)
A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch.
The organization defined as being responsible for creating the product as stated on the package in which the product is supplied. (BRIDG)
The identifier assigned to a particular design of a device, usually an alphanumeric text string.
The type of locking device used to securely fasten the electrical leads to the device. (NCI)
A unique identifier assigned to an individual object.
The classification of the cage structure used to immobilize the head or other body part in preparation for stereotactic surgery. (NCI)
The part of the name or logo associated with a specific product or service identifying and distinguishing it from varieties of the same product or service marketed by competing companies.
